summary: This is a chronological disciplinary record for inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein from the Bureau of Prisons, showing an expunged incident report from July 23, 2019, for alleged tattooing or self-mutilation. The report was later dismissed due to insufficient evidence.

persons.name: Epstein, Jeffrey Edward
persons.context: The inmate who is the subject of this disciplinary record, with an expunged incident report for alleged tattooing or self-mutilation.

persons.name: K. Hampton
persons.context: The Disciplinary Hearing Officer (DHO) chairperson who presided over the hearing for the incident report.

events.title: Alleged Tattooing/Self-Mutilation Incident
events.description: An incident report was filed against Jeffrey Epstein for alleged tattooing or self-mutilation while in custody.

events.title: DHO Hearing
events.description: A Disciplinary Hearing Officer (DHO) hearing was held to review the incident report, resulting in expungement due to insufficient evidence.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein had an incident report (3282555) for alleged tattooing or self-mutilation on July 23, 2019, while in custody.
The incident report was expunged after a DHO hearing on August 1, 2019, due to insufficient evidence to support the prohibited act.
The document is a Bureau of Prisons inmate disciplinary record, dated November 25, 2025, showing the chronological disciplinary history.
